IMG001.description: PA chest radiograph of a 58-year-old male with cough and fever

IMG002.description: Non-contrast CT head of a 72-year-old female with acute onset left-sided weakness

IMG003.description: H&E stained lung tissue biopsy at 40x magnification showing abnormal cellular architecture

IMG004.description: Supine AP abdominal radiograph of a 3-day-old neonate with bilious vomiting

IMG005.description: Dermoscopic image of a pigmented lesion on the back of a 45-year-old male

IMG006.description: Fundus photograph of the right eye of a 55-year-old diabetic patient

IMG007.description: T2-weighted axial MRI of the brain of a 35-year-old female with visual disturbances

IMG008.description: Lateral chest radiograph of a 65-year-old male with progressive dyspnea

IMG009.description: Contrast-enhanced axial CT abdomen of a 50-year-old female with right upper quadrant pain

IMG010.description: H&E stained breast tissue biopsy showing ductal structures with cellular proliferation

IMG011.description: Non-contrast CT head of an 84-year-old male with sudden severe headache, evaluate for subarachnoid hemorrhage

IMG012.description: Contrast-enhanced CT abdomen of a 19-year-old female with abdominal pain and vomiting, evaluate for bowel obstruction

IMG013.description: Contrast-enhanced CT abdomen of an 82-year-old female with severe abdominal distension and obstipation

IMG014.description: T2-weighted axial MRI brain of a 36-year-old female with visual disturbances and limb paresthesias suggesting demyelination

IMG015.description: T2-FLAIR axial MRI brain of a 34-year-old female with acute neurological deficits following recent viral illness

IMG016.description: Mammographic MLO view of a 65-year-old female with palpable breast lump during routine screening

IMG017.description: Mammographic CC view of a 40-year-old female with screening-detected suspicious abnormality

IMG018.description: Mammographic MLO view of a 31-year-old female with rapidly growing breast mass

IMG019.description: Fundus photograph of the right eye of an 85-year-old diabetic female for routine screening

IMG020.description: Fundus photograph of the left eye of a 4-year-old male for diabetic retinopathy screening

IMG021.description: Fundus photograph of the right eye of a 30-year-old diabetic female with blurred vision

IMG022.description: Dermoscopic image of a pigmented lesion on an 84-year-old male for lesion evaluation

IMG023.description: Dermoscopic image of a pigmented lesion on a 9-year-old male with atypical features

IMG024.description: Dermoscopic image of a suspicious pigmented lesion on the limb of a 43-year-old female

IMG025.description: Echocardiogram apical four-chamber view of a 75-year-old male with progressive dyspnea and systolic murmur

IMG026.description: Echocardiogram parasternal long axis view of a 47-year-old female with syncope and systolic murmur

IMG027.description: CT chest axial view of a 79-year-old male with incidental lung finding showing ground glass nodule

IMG028.description: CT chest axial view of a 59-year-old female with persistent cough showing solid pulmonary nodule

IMG029.description: CT chest axial view of a 35-year-old female with incidental part-solid pulmonary nodule

IMG030.description: Right upper quadrant ultrasound of a 33-year-old male showing gallstones without cholecystitis

IMG031.description: Right upper quadrant ultrasound of a 70-year-old female with right upper quadrant pain showing cholecystitis

RPT001.indication: 58M with cough, fever, and dyspnea for 5 days

findings.description: Airspace consolidation in the right lower lobe with air bronchograms
Small right-sided pleural effusion
Heart size is within normal limits

RPT001.impression: Right lower lobe pneumonia with small parapneumonic effusion. No cardiomegaly.
RPT001.comparison: No prior studies available for comparison

RPT002.indication: 72F with acute onset left-sided weakness, rule out stroke

findings.description: Hyperdense area in the right middle cerebral artery territory consistent with acute ischemic changes
findings.clinical_significance: Acute ischemic stroke in right MCA territory

findings.description: Loss of gray-white matter differentiation in the right insular cortex
No midline shift or hydrocephalus
findings.clinical_significance: No mass effect at this time

RPT002.impression: Findings consistent with acute right MCA territory ischemic stroke with early ischemic changes. No hemorrhagic transformation or significant mass effect.

findings.description: Irregular glandular structures with cellular pleomorphism and nuclear atypia
Stromal desmoplastic reaction surrounding tumor nests
Lepidic growth pattern along alveolar walls in peripheral areas
findings.clinical_significance: Mixed pattern adenocarcinoma with lepidic component

RPT003.impression: Invasive pulmonary adenocarcinoma, acinar predominant with lepidic component. Desmoplastic stromal response consistent with invasion.

findings.description: Dilated stomach and proximal duodenum creating a 'double bubble' sign
Paucity of distal bowel gas

RPT004.impression: Double bubble sign consistent with duodenal obstruction. Differential includes duodenal atresia, annular pancreas, or duodenal web. Surgical consultation recommended.

RPT005.indication: Pigmented lesion evaluation, rule out melanoma

findings.description: Asymmetric pigmented lesion with irregular borders
findings.clinical_significance: Asymmetry and border irregularity are concerning for melanoma (ABCDE criteria)

findings.description: Multiple colors including dark brown, light brown, and focal blue-white structures
findings.clinical_significance: Color variegation is a melanoma warning sign

findings.description: Atypical pigment network with irregular lines and globules

RPT005.impression: Pigmented lesion with dermoscopic features suspicious for melanoma: asymmetry, irregular border, color variegation, atypical pigment network. Excisional biopsy recommended.

RPT006.indication: 55M with diabetes, routine diabetic eye screening

findings.description: Scattered dot and blot hemorrhages in all four quadrants
findings.clinical_significance: Consistent with moderate non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy

findings.description: Hard exudates in a circinate pattern around the macula
Cotton wool spots in the superior arcade
findings.clinical_significance: Retinal nerve fiber layer infarcts, associated with diabetic retinopathy

findings.description: No neovascularization identified
findings.clinical_significance: No proliferative changes at this time

RPT006.impression: Moderate non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy with clinically significant macular edema. Referral for OCT and potential anti-VEGF treatment recommended.

RPT007.indication: 35F with visual disturbances and paresthesias, evaluate for demyelination

findings.description: Multiple periventricular T2-hyperintense lesions oriented perpendicular to the ventricles (Dawson's fingers)
Additional T2-hyperintense lesion in the right cerebellar peduncle
findings.clinical_significance: Infratentorial involvement supports MS dissemination in space

findings.description: No mass effect or restricted diffusion on DWI
findings.clinical_significance: No acute infarction or space-occupying lesion

RPT007.impression: Multiple T2-hyperintense white matter lesions in periventricular distribution with Dawson's fingers pattern and infratentorial involvement. Findings highly suggestive of multiple sclerosis. Recommend gadolinium-enhanced MRI to assess for active demyelination.

RPT010.indication: Breast biopsy for suspicious calcifications on mammography

findings.description: Atypical ductal epithelial proliferation with cribriform and micropapillary architecture
findings.clinical_significance: Features consistent with ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)

findings.description: Necrotic debris and calcifications within the ductal lumens (comedonecrosis)
findings.clinical_significance: Comedo-type DCIS, which is associated with higher recurrence risk

findings.description: No definite stromal invasion identified on multiple levels

RPT010.impression: High-grade ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), comedo type, with cribriform and micropapillary patterns. No stromal invasion identified. Recommend correlation with imaging extent and surgical margin assessment.
RPT010.technique: H&E stain, 10x and 40x magnification, multiple levels examined

RPT011.indication: 84M with sudden onset severe thunderclap headache

findings.description: Hyperdense material within the basal cisterns and sylvian fissures
No hydrocephalus or midline shift identified
findings.clinical_significance: No obstructive hydrocephalus at this time

findings.description: No parenchymal hematoma

RPT011.impression: Acute subarachnoid hemorrhage with blood in basal cisterns and sylvian fissures. CTA recommended to evaluate for underlying aneurysm.

RPT012.indication: 19F with abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting

findings.description: Mildly dilated small bowel loops up to 3.5 cm in diameter
findings.clinical_significance: Small bowel dilation suggesting partial obstruction

findings.description: Transition point identified in the distal ileum with decompressed bowel distally
Small amount of gas and fluid seen in the colon
findings.clinical_significance: Gas in colon indicates partial rather than complete obstruction

RPT012.impression: Partial small bowel obstruction with transition point in the distal ileum. Gas in colon confirms incomplete obstruction. Conservative management may be appropriate.
RPT012.technique: Contrast-enhanced CT abdomen and pelvis, axial 3mm sections

RPT013.indication: 82F with severe abdominal distension, obstipation, and bilious vomiting

findings.description: Markedly dilated small bowel loops up to 5 cm in diameter with multiple air-fluid levels
Abrupt transition point in the distal ileum with completely decompressed bowel distally
No gas in the colon or rectum
findings.clinical_significance: Confirms complete rather than partial obstruction

RPT013.impression: Complete small bowel obstruction with transition point in the distal ileum. No gas distally. Adhesive band obstruction is most likely given prior surgical history. Urgent surgical consultation recommended.
RPT013.technique: Contrast-enhanced CT abdomen and pelvis, axial 3mm sections

RPT014.indication: 36F with visual disturbances and limb paresthesias, evaluate for demyelination

findings.description: Multiple ovoid T2-hyperintense periventricular white matter lesions oriented perpendicular to the lateral ventricles (Dawson's fingers)
Several juxtacortical T2-hyperintense lesions in the frontal and parietal lobes
One T2-hyperintense lesion in the left cerebellar peduncle
findings.clinical_significance: Infratentorial involvement supports dissemination in space criteria

RPT014.impression: Multiple demyelinating lesions in periventricular, juxtacortical, and infratentorial locations consistent with multiple sclerosis meeting McDonald criteria for dissemination in space. Gadolinium-enhanced MRI recommended.

RPT015.indication: 34F with acute neurological deficits following viral illness, evaluate for ADEM

findings.description: Large bilateral asymmetric T2-FLAIR hyperintense white matter lesions involving the centrum semiovale and corona radiata
findings.clinical_significance: Large asymmetric lesions typical of ADEM rather than MS

findings.description: Involvement of the deep gray matter structures including bilateral thalami
findings.clinical_significance: Deep gray matter involvement favors ADEM over MS

findings.description: No restricted diffusion on DWI sequences

RPT015.impression: Large bilateral asymmetric white matter lesions with deep gray matter involvement following viral illness, consistent with acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM). Pattern distinguishable from MS by lesion size, symmetry, and thalamic involvement.

RPT016.indication: 65F with palpable breast lump, routine screening mammography

findings.description: Well-circumscribed oval mass with smooth margins in the upper outer quadrant
No associated microcalcifications or architectural distortion
No axillary lymphadenopathy

RPT016.impression: Well-circumscribed oval breast mass with benign morphology. BI-RADS 3 - probably benign. Short-interval follow-up mammogram in 6 months recommended.
RPT016.technique: Digital mammography, MLO and CC views

findings.description: Irregular mass with spiculated margins in the central breast
findings.clinical_significance: Spiculated margins raise concern for malignancy

findings.description: Associated cluster of pleomorphic microcalcifications
No skin thickening or retraction
findings.clinical_significance: No skin involvement at this time

RPT017.impression: Suspicious irregular spiculated mass with associated pleomorphic microcalcifications. BI-RADS 4C - high suspicion for malignancy. Core needle biopsy recommended.
RPT017.technique: Digital mammography, CC and MLO views with spot compression
RPT017.comparison: Prior mammogram 2 years ago was normal

RPT018.indication: 31F with rapidly enlarging palpable breast mass over 2 months

findings.description: Large dense irregular mass with spiculated margins measuring 3.5 cm
findings.clinical_significance: Highly suspicious morphology for invasive carcinoma

findings.description: Skin retraction overlying the mass with thickening of Cooper's ligaments
findings.clinical_significance: Skin involvement suggests locally advanced disease

findings.description: Enlarged axillary lymph nodes with cortical thickening
Associated fine pleomorphic and linear calcifications
findings.clinical_significance: Calcification pattern associated with high-grade DCIS component

RPT018.impression: Highly suspicious mass with skin retraction, suspicious calcifications, and axillary lymphadenopathy. BI-RADS 5 - highly suggestive of malignancy. Urgent tissue diagnosis required.
RPT018.technique: Digital mammography, MLO and CC views

RPT019.indication: 85F with long-standing diabetes, routine diabetic eye screening

findings.description: Scattered microaneurysms in the posterior pole
Few dot hemorrhages in the temporal retina
No hard exudates, cotton wool spots, or macular edema
findings.clinical_significance: No advanced features of diabetic retinopathy

RPT019.impression: Mild non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy with microaneurysms and few dot hemorrhages. No macular edema. Annual follow-up recommended.

RPT020.indication: Diabetic screening evaluation in young patient with type 1 diabetes

findings.description: Multiple dot and blot hemorrhages scattered across several quadrants
findings.clinical_significance: Hemorrhages in multiple quadrants indicate moderate NPDR

findings.description: Scattered hard exudates in the perimacular region
Few cotton wool spots in the superior arcade
findings.clinical_significance: Nerve fiber layer infarcts associated with retinal ischemia

findings.description: No neovascularization identified

RPT020.impression: Moderate non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy with dot/blot hemorrhages, hard exudates, and cotton wool spots. No proliferative changes. Follow-up in 6 months recommended.

RPT021.indication: 30F with diabetes and progressive blurred vision

findings.description: Neovascularization of the disc (NVD) with fibrovascular proliferation
Neovascularization elsewhere (NVE) along the superior temporal arcade
Preretinal hemorrhage in the posterior pole
Clinically significant macular edema with hard exudates

RPT021.impression: Proliferative diabetic retinopathy with neovascularization of the disc and elsewhere, preretinal hemorrhage, and clinically significant macular edema. Urgent panretinal photocoagulation and anti-VEGF therapy recommended.

RPT022.indication: 84M with long-standing pigmented lesion, routine evaluation

findings.description: Symmetric pigmented lesion with regular borders
Regular pigment network with uniform meshwork pattern
findings.clinical_significance: Typical pigment network of benign melanocytic nevus

findings.description: Homogeneous brown globules distributed evenly
findings.clinical_significance: Uniform globules consistent with benign nevus

RPT022.impression: Benign melanocytic nevus with symmetric architecture, regular pigment network, and homogeneous globules. No features of concern. Routine monitoring recommended.

RPT023.indication: 9M with changing pigmented lesion, family history of melanoma

findings.description: Mildly asymmetric pigmented lesion in one axis
findings.clinical_significance: Mild asymmetry may indicate atypical nevus

findings.description: Slightly irregular pigment network with focal thickening
Focal areas of regression (white scar-like areas)
findings.clinical_significance: Regression structures can be seen in both atypical nevi and early melanoma

RPT023.impression: Atypical melanocytic lesion with mild asymmetry, slightly irregular pigment network, and focal regression. Close dermoscopic monitoring recommended with consideration for excisional biopsy if changes progress.

RPT024.indication: 43F with new pigmented lesion with concerning features

findings.description: Highly asymmetric pigmented lesion in both axes
Blue-white veil overlying raised area of the lesion
findings.clinical_significance: Blue-white veil indicates dermal melanin and fibrosis, highly specific for melanoma

findings.description: Atypical vascular pattern with irregular dotted and linear vessels
Irregular streaks and pseudopods at the periphery

RPT024.impression: Dermoscopic features highly suspicious for invasive melanoma: two-axis asymmetry, blue-white veil, atypical vascular pattern, and peripheral streaks. Urgent excisional biopsy with appropriate margins required.

RPT025.indication: 75M with progressive dyspnea on exertion and holosystolic murmur at apex

findings.description: Prolapsing posterior mitral valve leaflet with flail segment
Moderate-to-severe mitral regurgitation jet directed posterolaterally on color Doppler
Dilated left atrium measuring 5.2 cm
Left ventricular ejection fraction preserved at 55%

RPT025.impression: Moderate-to-severe mitral regurgitation due to posterior leaflet prolapse with flail segment. Dilated left atrium. Preserved left ventricular function. Surgical consultation for mitral valve repair recommended.

RPT026.indication: 47F with exertional syncope and harsh systolic ejection murmur

findings.description: Calcified aortic valve with severely restricted leaflet motion
Peak aortic gradient of 65 mmHg, mean gradient 40 mmHg
Concentric left ventricular hypertrophy with wall thickness of 14 mm
findings.clinical_significance: Pressure overload hypertrophy secondary to AS

findings.description: Preserved left ventricular ejection fraction at 60%
findings.clinical_significance: Preserved systolic function despite severe AS

RPT026.impression: Severe calcific aortic stenosis with mean gradient 40 mmHg and concentric LV hypertrophy. Preserved LV function. Given symptoms of syncope, aortic valve replacement should be considered.

RPT027.indication: 79M with incidental lung finding on routine CT chest

findings.description: 8 mm pure ground glass opacity nodule in the right upper lobe
findings.clinical_significance: Ground glass nodule may represent atypical adenomatous hyperplasia or early adenocarcinoma spectrum

findings.description: No solid component identified within the nodule
findings.clinical_significance: Pure GGN without solid component has lower malignancy risk

findings.description: No mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy

RPT027.impression: Pure ground glass nodule in right upper lobe measuring 8 mm. No solid component. Follow-up CT in 6-12 months recommended per Fleischner Society guidelines to assess for growth or development of solid component.
RPT027.technique: CT chest without contrast, 1mm thin sections

RPT028.indication: 59F with persistent cough for 3 months, evaluate for lung pathology

findings.description: 15 mm solid nodule in the left lower lobe with spiculated margins
findings.clinical_significance: Spiculated solid nodule highly suspicious for primary lung malignancy

findings.description: No calcification within the nodule
findings.clinical_significance: Lack of benign calcification pattern increases suspicion

findings.description: No mediastinal lymphadenopathy identified

RPT028.impression: Suspicious solid pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe with spiculated margins. No calcification. PET-CT recommended for further characterization. Consider CT-guided biopsy or surgical resection.
RPT028.technique: CT chest with contrast, 1mm thin sections

RPT029.indication: 35F with incidental finding on screening CT chest

findings.description: 12 mm part-solid nodule in the right middle lobe with ground glass halo and 4 mm solid component
findings.clinical_significance: Part-solid nodules have the highest malignancy rate among lung nodule subtypes

findings.description: Well-defined ground glass component surrounding the solid core
findings.clinical_significance: Mixed composition suggests possible invasive adenocarcinoma with lepidic component

findings.description: No additional pulmonary nodules or lymphadenopathy

RPT029.impression: Part-solid pulmonary nodule in right middle lobe with 4 mm solid component. Part-solid nodules carry higher malignancy risk. Short-interval follow-up CT in 3 months recommended. If persistent, tissue sampling should be considered.
RPT029.technique: CT chest without contrast, 1mm thin sections

RPT030.indication: 33M with incidental finding during routine abdominal ultrasound

findings.description: Multiple echogenic foci within the gallbladder lumen with posterior acoustic shadowing
Normal gallbladder wall thickness measuring 2 mm
findings.clinical_significance: No wall thickening to suggest inflammation

findings.description: No pericholecystic fluid collection
Negative sonographic Murphy's sign

RPT030.impression: Cholelithiasis without sonographic evidence of acute cholecystitis. Normal gallbladder wall thickness, no pericholecystic fluid, negative Murphy's sign. Asymptomatic gallstones.
RPT030.technique: Right upper quadrant ultrasound with curvilinear probe

RPT031.indication: 70F with right upper quadrant pain, fever, and positive Murphy's sign on exam

findings.description: Multiple gallstones within a distended gallbladder
findings.clinical_significance: Cholelithiasis as likely cause of cholecystitis

findings.description: Thickened gallbladder wall measuring 6 mm (normal <3 mm)
findings.clinical_significance: Wall thickening consistent with acute inflammation

findings.description: Pericholecystic fluid collection surrounding the gallbladder
findings.clinical_significance: Pericholecystic fluid supports acute cholecystitis diagnosis

findings.description: Positive sonographic Murphy's sign with maximal tenderness over the gallbladder
findings.clinical_significance: Positive Murphy's sign is highly specific for acute cholecystitis

RPT031.impression: Acute cholecystitis: gallstones with thickened gallbladder wall (6 mm), pericholecystic fluid, and positive sonographic Murphy's sign. Surgical consultation for cholecystectomy recommended.
RPT031.technique: Right upper quadrant ultrasound with curvilinear probe

findings.description: Bilateral pleural effusions, larger on the right side
findings.clinical_significance: Bilateral effusions suggest systemic cause such as heart failure

findings.description: Blunting of both costophrenic angles with meniscus sign
Upper lobe pulmonary venous distension

RPT008.impression: Bilateral pleural effusions with upper lobe venous distension, consistent with congestive heart failure. Clinical correlation recommended.

RPT009.indication: 47F with headache after fall, evaluate for intracranial hemorrhage

findings.description: Hyperdense crescent-shaped collection along the right cerebral convexity
Mild mass effect with compression of the right lateral ventricle
Minimal midline shift of 3 mm to the left

RPT009.impression: Acute right-sided subdural hematoma with mild mass effect and minimal midline shift. Neurosurgical consultation recommended.

VQ001.question: What abnormality is seen in the right lower zone of this chest X-ray?
VQ001.answer: Right lower lobe consolidation consistent with pneumonia
VQ001.explanation: The chest X-ray shows airspace consolidation with air bronchograms in the right lower lobe, which is the hallmark appearance of lobar pneumonia.

VQ002.question: Is there a pleural effusion?
VQ002.explanation: A small right-sided pleural effusion is visible as blunting of the right costophrenic angle, likely a parapneumonic effusion.

VQ003.question: What is the most likely diagnosis based on this CT head?
VQ003.explanation: The CT shows a hyperdense area in the right MCA territory with loss of gray-white differentiation (insular ribbon sign), consistent with acute ischemic stroke.

VQ004.question: What type of lung cancer does this histology slide show?
VQ004.explanation: The histology shows irregular glandular structures with cellular pleomorphism, nuclear atypia, and desmoplastic stromal reaction, consistent with invasive pulmonary adenocarcinoma.

VQ005.question: What classic radiographic sign is seen on this neonatal abdominal X-ray?
VQ005.explanation: The double bubble sign represents a dilated stomach and proximal duodenum, classic for duodenal obstruction which can be caused by duodenal atresia, annular pancreas, or duodenal web.

VQ006.question: Based on the dermoscopic features, what is the most concerning diagnosis?
VQ006.explanation: The dermoscopy shows asymmetry, irregular border, color variegation with blue-white structures, and atypical pigment network - all suspicious features for melanoma.

VQ007.question: What stage of diabetic retinopathy is shown in this fundus photograph?
VQ007.explanation: The fundus shows dot/blot hemorrhages in all quadrants, hard exudates, and cotton wool spots but no neovascularization, consistent with moderate NPDR.

VQ008.question: What pattern of white matter lesions is most characteristic of multiple sclerosis on this MRI?
VQ008.answer: Dawson's fingers - periventricular lesions oriented perpendicular to the ventricles
VQ008.explanation: The MRI shows T2-hyperintense lesions in periventricular distribution perpendicular to the ventricles, known as Dawson's fingers, which is a classic MRI finding in MS.

VQ009.question: Are there any signs of macular edema?
VQ009.explanation: Hard exudates in a circinate pattern around the macula suggest clinically significant diabetic macular edema.

VQ010.question: What is the histological diagnosis of this breast biopsy?
VQ010.explanation: The histology shows atypical ductal epithelial proliferation with cribriform architecture and comedonecrosis without stromal invasion, consistent with high-grade DCIS.

VQ011.question: What type of intracranial hemorrhage is indicated by hyperdense material in the basal cisterns?
VQ011.explanation: Hyperdense material in the basal cisterns and sylvian fissures is the classic CT appearance of acute subarachnoid hemorrhage.

VQ012.question: Is this bowel obstruction partial or complete?
VQ012.explanation: The presence of gas in the colon distal to the transition point indicates that this is a partial rather than complete small bowel obstruction.

VQ013.question: What finding indicates complete rather than partial bowel obstruction?
VQ013.answer: Complete absence of gas in the colon and rectum distal to the transition point
VQ013.explanation: In complete bowel obstruction, there is no passage of gas or fluid beyond the point of obstruction, resulting in a decompressed distal colon and rectum without any gas.

VQ014.question: What classic MRI pattern is seen in this patient with suspected multiple sclerosis?
VQ014.answer: Dawson's fingers - periventricular lesions oriented perpendicular to the lateral ventricles
VQ014.explanation: Dawson's fingers are ovoid T2-hyperintense lesions in periventricular white matter oriented perpendicular to the ventricles, representing perivenular demyelination characteristic of MS.

VQ015.question: How does the ADEM pattern differ from multiple sclerosis on MRI?
VQ015.answer: ADEM shows large bilateral asymmetric white matter lesions with deep gray matter (thalamic) involvement, unlike the smaller periventricular lesions of MS
VQ015.explanation: ADEM typically presents with large, bilateral, asymmetric lesions involving both white matter and deep gray matter (especially thalami), often in a monophasic course after infection, unlike the smaller periventricular Dawson's fingers pattern of MS.

VQ016.question: What BI-RADS category would this well-circumscribed breast mass receive?
VQ016.explanation: A well-circumscribed oval mass with smooth margins and no calcifications or distortion is classified as BI-RADS 3 (probably benign) with less than 2% chance of malignancy, warranting short-interval follow-up.

VQ017.question: What features make this breast mass suspicious for malignancy?
VQ017.answer: Irregular shape with spiculated margins and associated pleomorphic microcalcifications
VQ017.explanation: Spiculated margins and pleomorphic microcalcifications are among the most concerning mammographic features for malignancy, warranting tissue sampling.

VQ018.question: What mammographic features suggest malignancy in this case?
VQ018.answer: Spiculated irregular mass with skin retraction, pleomorphic calcifications, and axillary lymphadenopathy
VQ018.explanation: The combination of a spiculated mass, skin retraction, suspicious calcifications, and axillary lymphadenopathy is highly suggestive of invasive breast carcinoma with possible nodal metastasis.

VQ019.question: What stage of diabetic retinopathy is shown in this fundus photograph?
VQ019.explanation: The presence of microaneurysms and few dot hemorrhages without more advanced features (cotton wool spots, venous beading, IRMA, neovascularization) classifies this as mild NPDR.

VQ020.question: What fundoscopic findings indicate moderate NPDR in this patient?
VQ020.answer: Multiple dot and blot hemorrhages in several quadrants with hard exudates and cotton wool spots, without neovascularization
VQ020.explanation: Moderate NPDR is characterized by more than just microaneurysms, including hemorrhages in multiple quadrants, hard exudates, and cotton wool spots, but without proliferative features like neovascularization.

VQ021.question: Is there evidence of proliferative diabetic retinopathy?
VQ021.explanation: Neovascularization of the disc (NVD) and neovascularization elsewhere (NVE) are definitive signs of proliferative diabetic retinopathy, distinguishing it from non-proliferative stages.

VQ022.question: Is this pigmented lesion likely benign or malignant based on dermoscopic features?
VQ022.answer: Benign - symmetric with regular pigment network
options: Benign - symmetric with regular pigment network
VQ022.explanation: The lesion shows symmetric architecture, regular pigment network, and homogeneous globules - all features consistent with a benign melanocytic nevus. No atypical features are present.

VQ023.question: What dermoscopic features make this pigmented lesion atypical?
VQ023.answer: Mild asymmetry, slightly irregular pigment network with focal thickening, and focal regression structures
VQ023.explanation: Atypical nevi show features intermediate between benign and malignant, including mild asymmetry, somewhat irregular pigment network, and occasionally regression structures, warranting close monitoring.

VQ024.question: What dermoscopic feature is most specific for melanoma in this lesion?
VQ024.explanation: The blue-white veil is one of the most specific dermoscopic features for melanoma, representing dermal melanin and fibrosis. Its presence in an asymmetric lesion with atypical vessels strongly supports melanoma diagnosis.

VQ025.question: What valvular abnormality is identified on this echocardiogram?
VQ025.answer: Mitral regurgitation due to mitral valve prolapse
options: Mitral regurgitation due to mitral valve prolapse
VQ025.explanation: The echocardiogram shows a prolapsing posterior mitral valve leaflet with a flail segment causing a moderate-to-severe posterolaterally directed regurgitation jet, characteristic of degenerative mitral valve disease.

VQ026.question: What is the primary diagnosis based on this echocardiogram?
VQ026.explanation: The calcified aortic valve with restricted leaflet motion, elevated gradients (mean 40 mmHg), and secondary concentric LV hypertrophy are diagnostic of severe aortic stenosis.

VQ027.question: What type of pulmonary nodule is seen on this CT?
VQ027.explanation: The nodule demonstrates uniform ground glass attenuation without any solid component, classifying it as a pure ground glass opacity (GGO) nodule, which may represent the adenocarcinoma spectrum.

VQ028.question: What features of this lung nodule are most concerning for malignancy?
VQ028.answer: Solid nodule with spiculated margins and absence of benign calcification pattern
VQ028.explanation: Spiculated margins in a solid pulmonary nodule are one of the most concerning CT features for lung malignancy, with the absence of benign calcification patterns further increasing suspicion.

VQ029.question: How would you classify this pulmonary nodule?
VQ029.answer: Part-solid nodule with mixed ground glass and solid components
options: Part-solid nodule with mixed ground glass and solid components
VQ029.explanation: This nodule contains both a ground glass component and a solid component, making it a part-solid (or subsolid) nodule. Part-solid nodules have the highest malignancy rate among all lung nodule subtypes.

VQ030.question: Is there evidence of acute cholecystitis on this ultrasound?
VQ030.explanation: Despite the presence of gallstones, the gallbladder wall is normal thickness (2 mm), there is no pericholecystic fluid, and Murphy's sign is negative, indicating asymptomatic cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.

VQ031.question: What sonographic findings confirm acute cholecystitis in this patient?
VQ031.answer: Gallstones, thickened gallbladder wall (6 mm), pericholecystic fluid, and positive sonographic Murphy's sign
VQ031.explanation: The classic sonographic triad of acute cholecystitis includes gallstones, gallbladder wall thickening (>3 mm), and positive sonographic Murphy's sign. Pericholecystic fluid provides additional supporting evidence.

VQ008b.question: What is the distribution of the pleural effusions seen on this chest radiograph?
VQ008b.explanation: Both costophrenic angles show blunting with meniscus signs, indicating bilateral free-flowing pleural effusions.

VQ009b.question: What type of intracranial hemorrhage is shown on this CT head?
VQ009b.explanation: The crescent-shaped hyperdense collection along the cerebral convexity that crosses suture lines is characteristic of a subdural hematoma.

PAT_IMG001.clinical_history: Type 2 diabetes, hypertension, former smoker (20 pack-years)
